page.title: 03FARMING
page.content:
Once again, the feature of this area is farmland with scattered housing including the lower slopes of Cleeve Hill.There is an intensive pig farm run by an ex-patriot Dane , Mr. J. Mellergaard.There is also an extensive mushroom farm owned by Mr.Deacon.
{Haymes (mushroom) Farm. Haymes Farm is a large, well set out establishment which sells about 1.5 million lbs.of mushroom each year. These go to local retailers as well as Tesco and Sainsburys supermarkets. Every week, 100 tons of horse manure are processed in special ovens after which it is spread on 'bunk-bed' pallets and sown with Swiss spores. Each spore measures about 3 microns. The fungi are ready for picking in 6 days, but it would take them a year in an open field.
